headline: Check your idea against existing patents.
description: Conduct a thorough search of existing patents - also known as Freedom to Operate search.

usageInfo.name: Disclaimer and Feedback Policy
usageInfo.text: This IP First Response website has been designed to help IP rights holders navigate IP infringement and enforcement by making it visible, accessible, and to provide information about the factors involved in pursuing different options. It does not provide legal, business or other professional advice, and none of the content should be regarded as recommending a specific course of action. We welcome any feedback via our IP First Response feedback form and by emailing us.

isPartOf.name: IP First Response
isPartOf.description: A first port of call for businesses to easily understand complex intellectual property issues.

mainEntity.name: Check your idea against existing patents.
mainEntity.description: Conduct a thorough search of existing patents - also known as Freedom to Operate search.

mainEntity.name: How to proceed with Check your idea against existing patents.

step.name: xXx_PLACEHOLDER_xXx
step.text: A clear description of your product, process or innovation.

step.name: xXx_PLACEHOLDER_xXx
step.text: Basic knowledge of what a patent is and what it protects.

step.name: xXx_PLACEHOLDER_xXx
step.text: Access to patent databases such as [AusPat](https://ipsearch.ipaustralia.gov.au/patents/), [Espacenet](https://worldwide.espacenet.com/) or [The Lens](https://www.lens.org/).

step.name: xXx_PLACEHOLDER_xXx
step.text: Optional: A qualified patent attorney to perform a professional search and interpret results.

step.name: xXx_PLACEHOLDER_xXx
step.text: A decision on whether you want to search only in Australia or also internationally.

acceptedAnswer.text:
* Reduces risk of accidentally infringing someone else’s patent.
* Can support investment decisions and product launches with greater confidence.
* Helps you understand the patent landscape in your industry.
* May reveal licensing opportunities or expired patents you can freely use.
* Helps inform whether you need to change your product or seek permission.
* Demonstrates to investors or partners that you’ve done your due diligence.

* Complex results may be difficult to interpret without expert help.
* Missed patents in the search may result in unexpected issues later.
* A ‘clear’ result can give false confidence if the scope of patents is misunderstood. Further clarification may require legal advice, which adds to costs.

* You identify existing patents that could pose a risk to your business.
* You find there are no relevant patents, and proceed with greater confidence.
* You discover expired patents, allowing free use of certain technologies.
* You use the findings to adapt your product or negotiate a licence.
* You decide to seek legal advice or conduct further searching.

You can do a preliminary search yourself at no cost using online databases, like [Australian patent Search](https://ipsearch.ipaustralia.gov.au/patents/) and [Espacenet – patent search](https://worldwide.espacenet.com/).

If you engage a patent attorney to perform or analyse the search:

* Professional fees typically range from $400 to $1100 per hour.
* Full searches and advice may cost between $2,000 to $7,000 depending on complexity.

Costs are generally higher for global searches or very technical fields.

mainEntity.name: How much time might be involved?

acceptedAnswer.text:
* A simple self-directed search may take a few hours to several days.
* A professional search and legal opinion may take 2 to 4 weeks depending on complexity.

* Any individual or business planning to launch a new product or process.
* Anyone concerned their innovation may overlap with existing patent rights.

* The business or person planning to launch a product or service.
* Optional: A patent attorney to conduct the search and provide analysis.
* Optional: Business advisors or investors who want to understand commercial risks.
